title: How to Become an Administrator on a Mac

steps.headline: Go to System Preferences, if you're already on the user whom you want to be Administrator of.
steps.description: This should be on your dock.

steps.headline: Go to "Users and Groups", which is under "System".
Click on the "Allow user to administer this computer" button.
steps.description:
A pop-up should come up, saying that, for these changes to take effect, you must restart your computer. Do so, and your user should be an Admin and have Admin powers! {"smallUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/thumb\/5\/5c\/Become-an-Administrator-on-a-Mac-Step-5.jpg\/v4-460px-Become-an-Administrator-on-a-Mac-Step-5.jpg","bigUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/thumb\/5\/5c\/Become-an-Administrator-on-a-Mac-Step-5.jpg\/v4-760px-Become-an-Administrator-on-a-Mac-Step-5.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":345,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":570,"licensing":"

tyn: A current Admin's username and password.
A Mac computer, whether it be a MacBook Pro, MacBook Air, or iMac.
text:
Go to System Preferences, if you're already on the user whom you want to be Administrator of. This should be on your dock. Go to "Users and Groups", which is under "System". Once there, you should see a bar with all of the users. Yours (the current user) should be on top. Click on the lock at the bottom of the screen. {"smallUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/8/87/Become-an-Administrator-on-a-Mac-Step-3Bullet1.jpg/v4-460px-Become-an-Administrator-on-a-Mac-Step-3Bullet1.jpg","bigUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/8/87/Become-an-Administrator-on-a-Mac-Step-3Bullet1.jpg/v4-760px-Become-an-Administrator-on-a-Mac-Step-3Bullet1.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":345,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":570,"licensing":"

License: Creative Commons


"} Type in a current Administrator's username and password in the spaces provided. If you don't have access to this information, you probably shouldn't be Admin on that computer. {"smallUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/0/0a/Become-an-Administrator-on-a-Mac-Step-3Bullet2.jpg/v4-460px-Become-an-Administrator-on-a-Mac-Step-3Bullet2.jpg","bigUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/0/0a/Become-an-Administrator-on-a-Mac-Step-3Bullet2.jpg/v4-760px-Become-an-Administrator-on-a-Mac-Step-3Bullet2.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":345,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":570,"licensing":"

License: Creative Commons


"} Click on the "Allow user to administer this computer" button. A pop-up should come up, saying that, for these changes to take effect, you must restart your computer. Do so, and your user should be an Admin and have Admin powers! {"smallUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/5/5c/Become-an-Administrator-on-a-Mac-Step-5.jpg/v4-460px-Become-an-Administrator-on-a-Mac-Step-5.jpg","bigUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/5/5c/Become-an-Administrator-on-a-Mac-Step-5.jpg/v4-760px-Become-an-Administrator-on-a-Mac-Step-5.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":345,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":570,"licensing":"

License: Creative Commons


"}
sentences: Go to System Preferences, if you're already on the user whom you want to be Administrator of.
This should be on your dock.
Go to "Users and Groups", which is under "System".
Once there, you should see a bar with all of the users.
Yours (the current user) should be on top.
Click on the lock at the bottom of the screen.

{"smallUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/thumb\/8\/87\/Become-an-Administrator-on-a-Mac-Step-3Bullet1.jpg\/v4-460px-Become-an-Administrator-on-a-Mac-Step-3Bullet1.jpg","bigUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/thumb\/8\/87\/Become-an-Administrator-on-a-Mac-Step-3Bullet1.jpg\/v4-760px-Become-an-Administrator-on-a-Mac-Step-3Bullet1.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":345,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":570,"licensing":"

License: Creative Commons<\/a>
\n<\/p>


\n<\/p><\/div>"} Type in a current Administrator's username and password in the spaces provided.
If you don't have access to this information, you probably shouldn't be Admin on that computer.

{"smallUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/thumb\/0\/0a\/Become-an-Administrator-on-a-Mac-Step-3Bullet2.jpg\/v4-460px-Become-an-Administrator-on-a-Mac-Step-3Bullet2.jpg","bigUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/thumb\/0\/0a\/Become-an-Administrator-on-a-Mac-Step-3Bullet2.jpg\/v4-760px-Become-an-Administrator-on-a-Mac-Step-3Bullet2.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":345,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":570,"licensing":"

License: Creative Commons<\/a>
\n<\/p>


\n<\/p><\/div>"} Click on the "Allow user to administer this computer" button.
A pop-up should come up, saying that, for these changes to take effect, you must restart your computer.
Do so, and your user should be an Admin and have Admin powers!
